The front desk staff at Lemon Tree are the best in the business! Every detail of our stay was handled with absolute care and professionalism. The rooms are nice and clean, and have all the things you need to make your stay comfortable. We like the location at Lemon Tree, as its close to all of the major amusement resorts, yet off the beaten path enough to avoid the crowds and congestion. The pool and jacuzzi come in handy, as well. What keeps us coming back time after time, is the great service provided by the staff at Lemon Tree. Manager L.J. always makes sure we have everything we need, and treats us as if he has a genuine concern for our well-being. Everyone at the front desk is fantastic! L.J.,  Mark, & Donovan, we'll be back!  Thanks for another great stay!   Sincerely,

This place is my go to hotel when i need a clean, comfortable and affordable place to stay. The manager LJ always goes above and beyond to make sure that I am taken care of. He is welcoming, courteous, and he is personable enough so that you truly feel like your a guest in his home. His example of great customer service trickles down to the staff who are all such nice hard working people. You can tell they all take such pride in the hotel and it shows.The rooms are always immaculate and quite spacious. Keep up the good work LJ and team. This hotel will keep me coming back for years to come.

The staff at Lemon Tree were wonderful and very accommodating. My family appreciated the Christmas Decor as well. Our room was immaculate and very comfortable. It is rare to be able to be in one room with all five of us. It was wonderful to have the large room and two TV's (no fighting!) The beds and linens were very nice. Breakfast was also very nice to have. There are multiple vending machines which my children enjoyed as well. The pool area is very nice and it was heated. The kids enjoyed their stay very much! HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!

Summary Heading: Great Price, Cleaning Rooms & Free Parking
Summary: Great location for visiting Disneyland and the surrounding areas wiht free onsite parking. It can be hard to get a space if you get back tot he hotel late in the evening. Rooms were immaculately clean with all the expected amenities.  Clothes washing facilities onsite and excellent desk services as had parcels delivered prior to arrival and all accepted with no issues prior to checking in.

From check in to check out LJ was top notch!  He went above and beyond to make everything as it should be when you are away from home!  The room was clean, maids were always available & breakfast was just what I needed to start my day!  Thank you LJ & all the staff at Lemon Tree Hotel & Suites!  I will be back for sure!

The Lemon Tree was very family friendly and safe. I came here with a friend and had my 85 year old grandma and her service dog over numerous evenings. I never felt uneasy bringing her over. The front desk also made sure that we felt comfortable having her service dog over as well. The staff was very respectful. We had the pleasure of visiting with LJ every morning when we went up to pay. He met all of our needs and went above and beyond to make sure we felt safe, comfortable, and relaxed. Thank you to LJ and all of the staff at the Lemon tree!

Summary Heading: Quiet, Clean, and Friendly! Awesome place!
Summary: My partner and I stayed at the Lemontree for over a week and during the entire stay, we felt like we were at home. The rooms were very clean. The property is fully gated, so we felt safe, no matter the time. The front desk was very helpful and friendly. LJ helped us numerous times when we needed assistance. He also made sure that we were as comfortable as possible during our stay. His friendliness and helpfulness was much appreciated. Overall, I couldn‚Äôt ask for better hospitality.

This hotel is quaint and updated with charming features. It is close to Disneyland with a short driving distance. The hotel itself offers a complimentary breakfast for its guest. This hotel offers a two bedroom suite which is great for a family outing at an affordable price.

Came to the Lemon Tree for a few days. Heard so much about it, had to come see for myself. Lj was the first one to check me in, he was kind, professional, and very quick on getting me on my way! My room was absolutely georgous! I stayed in one of the hot tub suites. Very clean, very modern yet warm and cozy! Staff are very quick to respond to any need i have. The laundry facility is clean and easy accessible. They keep the grounds very beautiful the Landscaping is stunning. The pool is nice and a breathe of fresh air compared to other hotels/motels in the area. The Lemon Tree is a fanstastic Hotel that you have to see and experience to believe. 5 star Hotel with 5 star service and 5 star rooms, yet very affordable. I am definitely coming back!

It's located in the ghetto and the place is crusty.  Walls are paper thin and some guests are rowdy and smoking all hours of the night.  My daugher got horrendous food poisoning from their breakfast bar and was vomiting the entire first day of Disneyland, had to leave park early.  My husband accidentally forgot his electric shaver and the cleaning staff did not turn it into lost and found but decided to keep it for themselves.  F this place!!!

If I did not have a Handicap Placard I would not have had a place to park.  Still had to park outside of gated area.

We picked this hotel because it was reasonably priced, had free, gated parking and was close to Disneyland. Our check in went great, the woman at the desk was super friendly. She said to me "I made your night, you're getting a kitchenette". So I asked her where the grocery store was, it was a few blocks away. The room was clean and comfortable, and we loved the kitchenette! It gave us a stove, and sink and a refrigerator. No cooking pots, pans or utensils but Thankfully, I had my own. Breakfast was hit or miss. One day it was very basic and another day it was a hot breakfast. We didn't swim but there a pool. I was definitely stay here again.

Great place to stay and affordable. As soon as my wife and I walked inside LJ welcomed us with great service and hospitality. We felt very comfortable and excited to stay here at Lemon Tree! Thank you LJ !

We stayed for a week in a family suite. We had an entryway with a roomy bathroom off that and two separate bedroom, one with a king bed and the other with two queen beds. This was perfect for grandparents, two adult children and two tweens. The rooms were clean and the staff very helpful. The stay included breakfast was adequate on weekdays (cereal, toast, frozen waffles,muffins) but included sausage,hard boiled eggs and a waffle maker on weekends. There is a pool and hot tub. The hotel was very quiet at night. This hotel was very convenient to Disneyland, the Honda Center, the Anaheim Transportation center and Angel Stadium. We would stay here again.

Us two girlfriends spent three nights at the Lemon Tree Hotel & Suites in March 2019.  The staff is friendly and gave us information on places to eat. It was a quiet stay.  The property is clean, the swimming pool is clean and the room was perfect: 2 queen beds, tv, mini kitchen and small bathroom. There are no musty smells.  We chose no housekeeping while we were there because we wanted to sleep in without interruption.  There is a gate which rolls open with key swipe and closes as the car enters the parking lot.  This made us feel safe.  There is plenty of parking.

I made this a stop off on a long drive from San Diego to the San Francisco Bay Area. I saw so many complaints for $45-55 motels along the highways. So I decided to boost my budget a bit. I'm so glad I did. This hotel has a security gate to fend off transients. The room size is good.  It's clean. Bed is comfortable. I'd stay here again.

Stayed here for the first time because hotels around Disney were sold out or expensive. We were very happy with this hotel and have booked again for May. It was easy to drive to Disney then take the shuttle in to the park. Thank you to LJ for his friendly service.

An older couple in front of me did the same thing. The staff were good about refunding my money and were nice overall, providing an ironing board quite promptly when requested.    Bed and pillows were comfy. Though rooms are very basic. Breakfast is a joke! Hardly any selection, looks like everything was purchased at the dollar store.   The internet was very unreliable.

The coffee, well as someone who loves coffee, it was not good at all. But the daytime front desk person LJ was super awesome, and my maid, I really hate calling her that, was chill as.... well she was cool also. If you are looking for a super low key and mellow spot, I would totally recommend here.

LJ was extremely helpful and professional. He made our experience truly wonderful. We would stay here again for the nice hottub and pool, free breakfast, or comfortable beds, but we will DEFINITELY be back because LJ took such great care of us.

The rooms are very clean,it's in a good area, and the staff especially the counterman (LJ) are nice and respectable. The pool is very big and fun to swim in. The sleep is great and very cozy and warm. All and all your gonna have a good time.

The rooms are very clean and neat, the pool and hot tube are very exquisite and clean. I really enjoyed the pool and the tv had really good channels, this place is a good spot for the whole family. The staff was very helpful, especially the front desk man LJ, they made it very easy to stay here and really made it feel like home.

We will definitely be staying at this hotel again, the next time we head down to Disneyland.

Staff are great and friendly and very helpful when it comes to tours and welcome package. Very centrally located near shops and the markets. Amazing plane in the court yard, great for FB. A must visit place!

Summary: I have wrote a review before and this will be my second review. Which I personally believe the 2nd review is more important than the first.. I discovered the Lemmontree Inn A couple months ago and since my first experience I have been back quite a few times to California and have made reservations here. Very chill atmosphere. Good vibes and excellent customer service from all staff members. They make it feel like a home away from home.. I've stayed in many different hotels and not one has stood out like this one!! The rooms are nice and clean and each one has its own unique style . No two rooms are alike. I would absolutely recommend the lemontree Inn to Anyone looking for a experience while away from home.. LJ IS ALWAYS AMAZING! He deserves to be recognised for his outstanding

LJ checked us in today and was more than helpful and cooperated with us perfectly  All the  motels around here have horrible front desk staff , lemon tree should be greatful to have a wonderful employee The room is perfect with a good view of the pool  Very clean and home  We are content

Centrally located near Disneyland and Angels Stadium this property is a still. The rooms have been updated and some include spa baths. The property is spotless and they offer AAA Discount. The customer service is on point especially the front desk staff. Both LJ & Lin went above and beyond to accommodate my party during a week long stay. I highly recommend this property if you are visiting the Anaheim area.

Greeted by frontdesk manager LJ. Very friendly n helpful. Very accommodating. After stating how tired we was from flight, LJ offered us a early check-in without charge with understanding AC was not working for now. Later that afternoon AC was fixed as promised. Room was clean and  comfortable, very very cold AC (after fixed), free breakfast, and WiFi They  also had a pool and jacuzzi. Would definitely stay again.

We spent 6 nights here to visit Disneyland theme parks. We got a family suite here at this hotel. Here are the pros and cons. Pros:  Front desk people were nice.  Room was cleaned up everyday and they did good job.  Maybe because it was a family suite, it got a full size fridge which is awesome. We put lots of food and stuff for the trip.  Hotel has a ok-to-nice pool and hot tub.  Cons: They serve breakfast but their breakfast is a joke. Waffle, cereal, milk, sauce, coffee, apple,  and orange... Literally those are what you have everyday. We only ate for 1 morning (oh and whoever had the milk got diarrhea that day)... I'm not really sure if its the milk for I didn't drink it and I didn't get the diarrhea.. anyway we all stopped eating their breakfast after that except for the

LJ is the best in the business!   Really knows how to take care of his guests. Would stay again!!!! Only an 8 dollar Uber ride to Disney. Best pancake house within walking distance from hotel. Hot tub always hot!

Very charming hotel. Room was very clean and comfortable. Pool was warm and front desk staff was great. Breakfast, on the other hand was the worst I've ever seen. We were there well before closing and had to stand in line for ten minutes. There ran out of plates, forks, knives and cups. No staff were to be found. The sausage was still frozen. They ran out of muffins and only had hard boiled eggs. The milk and cereal were gone so we only had a waffle which had to be flipped twice because the toaster was broken and it had to be eaten in a bowl with a spoon...Orange juice tasted like water. I am very low maintenance, but was appalled. It's a shame that all of the hard work of the staff has been overshadowed by a complete lack of work on behalf of the breakfast crew. I would

The staff at Lemon Tree was amazing they help with everything they give breakfast vouchers, map of the hotel, and clean friendly environment LJ was very helpful I came earlier than check in time and he held my stuff for me.

It was i wonderful trip very friendly hotel i would like to thanks LJ very much for his advise and support he is very helpful guy he helps me actually to save some money which i will used for other activity .thanks a lot

Thanks to LJ I always have a great time whenever I'm in Anaheim. This is a great hotel. I'd highly recommend the hot tub room. It's a lot of fun! They've also got a great pool. It's just a really nice place to go to get away.

Thanks to LJ for making us feel good to stay at the lemon tree hotel best hotel in Anaheim and he was super friendly and  great customer service we would recommend this place it was nice and clean with pool and a place to barbecue and enjoy the weekend

It's got everything that comes standard with a usual hotel. It's one of the nicest ones in the neighborhood, the rooms were quiet. had air conditioning. The bathrooms are the absolute best feature of the room, they have nice marble floors and granite counter tops, if that's the sort of thing you enjoy in a hotel room. The beds weren't took uncomfortable, but we could have used a few more pillows. Overall it was a satisfactory stay for 2 nights.

LJ made it easy to check in and out. It was a very smooth process. The suite was clean and comfortable. The next time I am visiting Anaheim, I will be sure to stay here. I like the 2 room option because it was practical for our family.

My partner and I have been relocating to the area and we needed a place to stay while looking.  We happened to find the Lemon Tree Hotel.  It fit our budget and seemed like a nice place (from the reviews online).  One of the amenities that this hotel has that many others lack is a kitchenette- something with an oven (my partner is an awesome cook).  They only had a handful of those rooms (however I believe they are in the process of removing the ovens altogether- not quite sure).  Also it offered a complimentary breakfast!  I'm all about free breakfast!  The gentleman at the desk was very nice and got us a room real fast.   It was on the first level and had a parking spot right next to it!  The kitchen was a little small but we were happy to have it.  The room was good... love

I would like to acknowledge LJ for his service. He has a great attitude and helped me out substantially with everything. I'm writing this because his services cannot be ignored! I cant help but mention the fact I definitely got my moneys worth staying here! Being able to unwind from all the curve balls life has been throwing at me was needed. Also the layout of this place is absolutely peaceful. Hopefully the staff here will stay enjoying my company with my continuing visits. Thank you!

Our daughter's wedding took place in a nearby park, and many guests, ourselves included, were coming from out of town.  The Lemon Tree offered great price/property value for our group.  The pool and well-kept grounds provided a nice oasis in the middle of town, a place where people could relax.  The clean rooms have been fairly recently remodeled.  Kudos to LJ and his staff for working with us on multiple room arrangements, changes, etc.

I have made a review for this place before and I had to make another because these people rock. The rooms rock, The whole feeling of the place rocks.  My ex and I broke up and that left me on the streets, these people worked with me on prices saying they will beat whatever I show them, the maids and front desk every morning greet me with smiles and hellos like we've known each other for years.  The maintenance also is just so sweet and always willing to help even with my luggage or groceries. The common area by the pool has a bbq set up that is just cozy and makes you feel like everyone is family.  It is packed every night so obviously people are getting the word out, so please come to the lemon tree and feel this little bit of heaven too.

My stay at Lemon Tree Hotel was very relaxing. The setting felt like an apartment setting by having a bbq and chairs outside. The service was also very good! LJ assisted us and was very welcoming and helpful. Definitely recommend this hotel!

Summary Heading: Got to say that LJ save our lives on our vacation thank you LJ
Summary: We had an awesome experience here at the lemon tree it was great because the first motel we stayed at was garbage so when we found the lemon tree hotel we felt we hit the jackpot was so clean smelled great bathrooms were shiny it didn't smell like smoke which was awesome I will definitely recommend this hotel to family and friends I will vouch for them thank u guys.

Summary Heading: Lemonade out of Lemon Tree Inn
Summary: My partner and I recently relocated from Greenwich Connecticut to Pasadena California. Upon arrival to our dismay we realize that our home was not ready yet. My partner works for Disney Studios so we decided to make a vacation out of it and stay near Disneyland Park. Little bit of research we decided upon the Lemon Tree Inn and Suites. Let's begin with the only negative. The hotel is currently under slight renovations so this won't be a factor to anyone who's staying after June. Now for the positive. The staff could not be more accommodating and friendly. The ever-present cleaning staff do not hesitate to say good morning and ask you how is your stay. Special mention to general manager LJ who at the time of our arrival had a phone in each hand a walkie talkie and still manage to

Lt. Was a awesome host at The Lemon Tree Hotel in Anaheim he made our stay great he was so accommodating to whatever we needed I most definitely will be staying at this hotel the next time and I'm in Anaheim thank you

Summary Heading: So many special details and great customer service.
Summary: This place is magical, filled with charm and details from another time. LJ at the front desk was a true gem.  The courtyard and special sitting areas make it so special. This the place you come to and find a good spot to write.

Wonderful stay. The staff is incredibly accomadating and do everything they can to make you feel at home. LJ at the front desk is the best! He's kind, efficient, and knowledgeable. He set the tone for my stay by being so warm and friendly. I definitely recommend this hotel!

The hotel is affordable and gives out a welcoming vibe.  We stayed for over 10 days and loved it. Kids enjoyed the breakfast, free wifi and the pool. We even managed a family BBQ night at the complimentary BBQ pit provided by the hotel Walking distance from supermarkets, restaurants and hotel also provided free transfers to/from Disney (needs to be booked 01 day before)

Really nice hotel affordable price very clean and staff very nice people we visit Anaheim for a little vacation in Memorial Day week and chose this hotel very please... beach from here 30 minute drive not bad.. they could have better breakfast.. but there a couple of breakfast places right around the corner..  overall nice hotel.. thanks..

I was on vacation with my parents and had a bad experience at another hotel.  We stopped by at the Lemon Tree and were so impressed with LJ, he was very courteous and accommodating to our needs.  We were able to stay in a newly remodeled room, it was very quiet and right by the pool.  The gardens were beautiful!!  the pool was very clean, we had a great time!    One recommendation would be to have safes in the rooms as well as phones.  Other than that we were very happy with our stay!!

Summary Heading: I don't normally write a review
Summary: The lemontree inn. It was very affordable and accommodating. The staff is amazing it made my vacation perfect! When I come back to the OC this is where I will stay everytime !!! LJ the front desk clerk very professional and has incredible customer service skills!!! Thank you guys! I'll see you again!üòâ 5 stars

Excellent front desk guy LJ was super courteous! Our family suite was very spacious and clean. Pool was perfect! Enjoyed waffles and orange juice for breakfast! Definitely will book again if in the area!

I stayed at this hotel last week during the Run Disney weekend. I accidentally left my running shoes, socks, and pants in my hotel room. I realized my mistake while I was driving to the airport. I spoke to the front desk clerk Mark, he assured all I needed to do was email them a shipping label. Mark was able to retrieve my shoes, pants and socks.   I email them the label. It has been 1 week since I left that hotel. I have not received my items. I get the run around from "Jose", who keeps telling me " speak to manager Lin Fu".   Horrible service. No one wants to call back nor respond to emails. This is the last time I will stay here for 4 days.

Very friendly staff, not just at the desk but all the staff is friendly and helpful. Housekeepers are awesome. Room was very clean, even my wife said so and she is strict when it comes to judging rooms because she herself is a housekeeper. We got a family suit which was big, had plenty of room and then some for my family of 5. For being on a busy road it was a quiet and pleasant stay. I definitely recommend it and will return here if and when we go to disneyland again

We stayed in a family suite which was HUGE.  It was such a comfortable stay and facilities were great including the pool. It was great having a ride to Disneyland. The service was marvelous especially the breakfast.

Stumbled upon this little gem a few months ago, & so glad we did! Lj is always so accommodating even when you need a last minute booking, or to extend your stay a day or two. We always feel comfortable when we stay here; more so like a home away from home. Each room is different which is fun and gives the hotel character. They also offer different accommodations depending on your needs; some offer a kitchenette, jacuzzi, or even just a nice view of the pool. Thank you, Lj & staff for always making us feel welcome and providing a great stay!

overall was great stay. the reception Lj, Lin, Mark,and Carlos was awesome. they make me feel like i am home. they welcome us at check in and meet all the request that we needed. We will deferentially recommend this hotel to our family and friends. thank you all for the helps.

What a wonderful way to start a vacation!  I was so thankful that the hotel has shuttle service to Disneyland!  And to be able to soak my feet in the still warm hot tub after walking the Park all day was AMAZING!!!  It's great to have a nice warm breakfast waiting along with friendly staff keeping it fresh!  Besides having a very low (if any) wifi signal, especially during peak hrs., my kids and I think it is the best place we've ever stayed and we'll definitely return.  I've already recommended it to some friends and family! =)

Summary: I enjoyed my time at this location with my family, the staff is very nice. I will stay again in this place. The king size bed is in one room and the 2 queen size and the other room with a door so you can have your privacy.

I often come to this hotel to get out of the house and also in between moving or fumigating my home. Every time I come everyone including housekeepers &LJ  are so welcoming. It's beautiful and home like!

Service at the front desk with LJ was great he made great accommodations for the guest and was a great service for the shuttle to the Disney parks. The breakfast was a great way to start off our days for Disneyland. Rooms were clean and comfy

Summary Heading: Favorite place to stay in Anaheim
Summary: I really enjoyed my time at this location the staff is great especially the front desk employee LJ. He made sure my family's stay was very comfortable. Will definitely return. The location is very convenient and very nice for the price. Can't beat this hotel :)

I stayed at the lemon tree hotel and sweet last night. Got in pretty late took my family out to dinner at the pirate show I was welcomed with love respect and great customer service. I have kids that enjoyed their time playing in the Jacuzzi so the floors got a little wet and we called customer service a few times they came with pleasant smile's bringing us towels and whatever it was that we needed, they did not make us feel like we were a hassle or annoyed we appreciated that! Thanks to the management team continue to do right by your guest!

Great hotel with great staff at the front desk that will help you out with anything that you may need great people lemon tree very nice and clean and once agian great staff especially the front desk staff

Me and my friends were extremely impressed with the staff and service we received during our stay at the Lemon Tree hotel in Bangaluru. The rooms were beautiful, the food was delicious, and it was obvious that every staff member we encountered had a genuine desire to accommodate us and make sure we were having a delightful stay.  If you go, make sure you go up to the spa and get yourself a massage. Those ladies do a wonderful job for a very reasonable price. I definitely would return.

My stay at the lemon tree was impecible. The cleanliness was outstanding and I couldn't ask for better service. Ok was always the most curteous and helpful. The staff makes you feel at home. The room with the patio is huge. All the sMtaff were very helpful. The saroundings were nice an mellow settings. The best stay by far an I can't wait to stay another night.1A

Summary Heading: Our stay at Lemon Tree was Perfect
Summary: Stayed 3 days was just perfect rooms were clean ,They have a free breakfast with a heated pool and Hottub .The man at the front desk LJ was very kind and helpful.Very close to All kinds of places to eat it within walkin distance also Wal-Mart's near by if needing Supplies.

I loved the hotel. At first I thought the price for the family room was a bit over the top, but it's definitely worth it. Maids are hard working and sweet, they're also bilingual and polite. The men at the front desk were nice and helpful. Breakfast in the hotel was pretty good, but I think that they should serve a little more food to feed everyone. Don't worry about the reviews that say that breakfast runs out quickly, breakfast lasts from 7 AM to 11 AM, you have more than enough time and they always refill what's gone. Noise is not an issue in this hotel but there are a few noisy families every now and then.  Our room was great. There were two queen sized beds and one king sized bed, the rooms were seperated by a wall but in the same room. There was a full size fridge that

Amazing facilities! The customer service is second to none. LJ is quite the employee! He made sure we got the best deals for the best rates! He was very accommodating, super friendly, and just all around refreshing! We even booked another day! Lol. The breakfast is hot and cooked to perfection, unlike most places. The area is nice and you can get a good night's rest. We'll definitely be visiting again. Thanks LJ!

We stayed at the lemon tree for 5 nights. LJ At the front counter was great. He moved us to the pool side . The staff was great.  Breakfast, skip it unless you like white bread and cooked eggs or cereal. Coffee was average

Very friendly staff, clean, great value! Good breakfast.  We had a minor issue with our room and LJ at the front desk accommodated us, super fast! Made sure we were satisfied. We would definitely stay here again!

I have been coming to this hotel on business for the past 6 months and have never had a bad review. LJ and staff have been stellar from the first day. now when I call they know who I am and what room I  like. I have left things in my room by mistake and they have called me before I have missed it and keep them until I return! Thank you LJ, Lyn and mark for making my stay every week so good.

Summary Heading: The family Suite is well worth the money
Summary: I had a very enjoyable pleasant stay here. Well worth the money.  The hotel was very clean. The manager LJ took care of us.  Make sure to request a pool side room as the Blvd side can get busy during rush hours. Unless you like the sound of traffic. :)  The staff was very friendly * accommodating across the board as well.

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for
Summary: Great location close proximity to theme parks which is what we were doing for our stay. They have onsite parking and laundry facilities. There are food outlets and shops in walking distance which was great. Staff here were very friendly and helpful. Rooms were modern but basic but we weren't there to spend much time in the room. We stayed on the road side which can we a little load but I guess that's up to personal preference.

We came here on vacation and loved our stay here, very clean and the people were so helpful and very nice to us, specially Lin in the front , he was very polite and respectful, Lin was amazingly professional , I know it sounds weird but you don't get that much now a days, we loved our stay and definetely coming back

Summary Heading: Great service,  Great price, Great location to Disney.
Summary: We stayed at the lemon tree for two nights.   It was great. Front man LJ was very courteous and of timely manner for the check in and check out. The room was very nice and the breakfast was good too.   I'm not sure if the neighborhood isn't safe, but there were people (not hotel occupants)  fighting on the hotel property.  That was my only complaint. This happened while we were outside too. When we rushed in to the lobby and notified the front desk, the response time of the police felt like it was under 30 seconds.   Disney is very close as well if you have your own car.  There are other great places to eat near by.   Overall a great experience.

This was perfect for what I needed. I had my room with a door that closed and my daughter had her room along with her daughter and friend. The rooms were large and we went to the sauna and it was so clean and the rooms were very clean. Loved the flat screen. It was great to have a kitchen in one of the rooms. Large refrigerator was nice. And if that wasn't enough then you get free breakfast.

Stopped in for a late night check in before going into Disneyland the next morning.  Room was a little outdated but comfortable.  We chose this hotel due to the location and price and the free breakfast. Problem was breakfast didn't start until 7am and that's too late for families that want to get to the park before the gates open at 8am and want to get there early enough to beat the lines.

The hotel rooms were on the process of renovation but we enjoyed staying there.The pool was really good.It was close to Disneyland but not walk able distance.Shuttle service from the hotel did not match our time and it was inadequate.There are Asian restaurants and one Taco Bell nearby.Overall our stay was good.

Summary Heading: Not the best choice in Anaheim
Summary: First disappointment was from a misleading advertisement about (complimentary Disneyland shuttle service), yes they offer it but only 2 trips going to Disneyland and only one returning at 1030pm on a first come first serve basis. The pool was freezing. The breakfast was average, one day they did not refill the juices, coffee or waffle mix 30 minutes before closing. The rooms were average, our 2nd day the room attendants forgot our towels. Nothing close within walking distance. For the price you pay, stay someplace else closer to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: They are under construction right now but it will be great!
Summary: When the remodeling is finished it will be a great stay. My room really needed updating but my daughter's family stayed in the suite next to my room and it was absolutely beautiful. They are also updating the breakfast room at the moment.

I booked a room the night before a planned Disneyland trip. I was embarrassed by how shabby and old the room was. We were on the main floor in a corner by a utility closet. There was construction going on in the lobby which wasn't so bad but breakfast, that was bad. Breakfast was served in an unused room to the side of the lobby. The frozen sausage was served cold, there was no salt and pepper for the hard boiled eggs. I asked the attendant and she said she didn't know if they had salt and pepper. We reluctantly sat at a sticky table. I finally found the salt. It was a whole carton, not even a salt shaker or packets a carton. I will never stay there again not will I ever recommend this place to anyone! Oh and the slide chain lock was put on backwards thus making it ineffective.

Summary Heading: No frills, basic hotel, close to Disney. You get what you pay for
Summary: We booked our trip at the last min and booked hotels only 2 days before we got on the plane. Needless to say since we booked so late, there wasn't a lot of options to choose from. Lemon Tree came up, price was reasonable, close to Disney and had 2-bedroom suit to accommodate 4 people so we chose this one. We were assigned to a room on the 2nd floor but there were no elevators. We had to take our luggage up the stairs. The room was very old and in need of renovation badly. The next morning, they offered us another 2-bedroom on the main floor for $20 more a night. We decided to take it and it was a great decision we made. The 2nd room we had was renovated and was way better but by no mean luxurious. Breakfast was included but it was very basic. I wanted to stay at a hotel nearby Disneyland, not spend too much, but still have an enjoyable stay. Lemontree met all those needs. They even had a shuttle, though I missed it because I slept in. Still enjoying the stay as the rooms are quite cozy. Nice to stay at a place with a TV with an hdmi. Was able to hook i up my laptop and use their wifi to make myself more at home. Not to mention the pool is always a plus. Great experience for what you pay for.

As any typical horror story, it starts off with a friendly staff at the front desk.    After checking in, we found out that there are no elevators.  We had to lug our heavy luggages up 1 floor.  We got a 1 bedroom suite with 1 king sized bed and 2 double beds. The clay floor tiles greet us in the room and it's acceptable in an attempt to make it a Spanish theme. I smell something emanating from the nearby kitchenette and notice that one coil on the electric stove top was lifted up and it was out of place. We notice right away that the furniture, cabinets and fixtures look like they were salvaged from garage sales, flea markets, and homes that are getting rid of their old cabinets. None of them matched.  A hardwood TV armoire sandwiched between a modern sleek metallic buffet and

Really nice hotel probably one of our favorites to stay at when we're in Anaheim. Good internet comfy rooms nice employees. The price is always good here and you're only minutes away from Disneyland!!

I stayed at Lemon tree hotel for a week, everybody here is very nice, my room is very clean everyday. They had best breakfast with eggs and sausage, everything is very good, I recommend this place. They have a nice clean swimming pool, and I had a nice time in the pool.

Summary Heading: Friendly staff but rooms need updating...
Summary: We stopped here for one night and took two rooms. It looked great in the pictures on their website but our rooms were not quite clean or modern. Free breakfast was a bun fight but the one staff looking after the area did her best to stock up as quickly as she could.   Rooms we stayed in were smelly and needed updating. Hair dryer didn't work and the toiletries bottles didn't have any shower gel or shampoo/conditioner!  I would say it's more a motel than a hotel based on our experience.

I booked this hotel online and it looked pretty nice in the pictures. "Hotel" was actually a "Motel" and was pretty old and worn. Plumbing was loud while running the shower- and the rooms were a little cramped with too much furniture in the room. Plus would be that there were appliances so you could store and prepare food on a longer stay- and the staff was friendly.

Summary Heading: Really nice place to stay - we loved it!
Summary: Very clean room, pleasant service, Spanish feel to the layout of the motel.  Also included breakfast which was great.  And internet terminal which was invaluable for us. Also only 10-15 minutes from Disneyland at the most.  We were so happy to stay here and we'd be happy to stay here again.

We had a very nice experience at the Lemon tree hotel. We booked through an online hotel service without really reading reviews. I am sure glad we did.  Had I read the reviews from some sites before we booked, we may not have stayed there. ( I looked at a few after we booked, and had some concerns). The service was excellent and the staff friendly and accommodating. The hotel is older, but for me that was part of the charm. We had a slight problem with the TV's when we first arrived, but they sent someone up right away and the issue was resolved without delay. The evening front desk person, was very kind and helpful, sorry I don't remember his name. The next morning we went down for the continental breakfast, which had a nice variety and good coffee :o)  We will definitely plan

Ni nice family Hotel. Breakfast was plenty and they kept refilling waffles hard boiled eggs Danish four kinds  of cereal hot oatmeal. Apples and oranges. The maids are okay if they forget something just ask the front desk and they give it to you. Kmart and a good supermarket one block away, Walgreens, and dollar store

Nice Room - Cozy  Small but enough space for two people.  Disney is close as evidenced by the fireworks banging at 9:00pm.  Breakfast was good and the staff was great.  The room and bed were clean and comfortable.  Recommend this place to anyone.

After reading some reviews I was skeptical but decided to go for it and I was pleasantly surprised. For this price it was pretty good; for a bit less you could stay motel but why?! This place was far better in that it was modern for the most part, clean, and very affordable. If you are looking for something nice and affordable but not cheap this place is where to go. Based on the other reviews I see people are expecting too much and don't understand that for this area this hotel is great if you can't swing for a Marriott or Hilton.

Summary Heading: Not great location but very impressed with the room and amenities
Summary: The view from the street is not impressive and the hotel itself is inconveniently situated in a really busy road with somewhat difficult parking. However, those were my biggest problems with this place.  This is a cheaper alternative for families going to Disneyland or for anybody going on business; I was pleasantly surprised when we went inside the room. The room itself is huge, clean and renovated (however, I believe we were placed in the newer building in the back; not sure what the main building rooms are like.) That being said, I loved the room. The TV was huge, the bed was relatively clean and comfortable, the view from the balcony was amazing and the room had everything we needed (this one actually had a suction fan which is still crazy to me how many hotels don't have

Great hotel with all type facilities and near by all place visit very easy Lovely room and delicious food My family enjoy roof top swimming pool  Hotel staff very helping nature  Room interior very fine

Summary Heading: Family place while visiting Disneyland, needs more updating.
Summary: We stayed in a "newly renovated" room, not quite sure what that meant, but was glad we had that versus what their older rooms look like. Still in need of major renovating, carpets were scary, bathrooms way outdated and one of us fell in the shower/tub and few others had close calls because it was so dangerous, beds like boards and pillows were flat as pancakes. Woke up sore. Don't bother w the breakfast. Hard boiled eggs and frozen, reheated sausage links, watered down oj and few other packaged foods were not worth the effort or a meal to start a big day. On the upside. Rooms do have full size refrigerator, microwave and sink. TV remote didn't work in master bedroom,  so didn't bother watching...who wants to get in and out of bed after long days at Disney to chg channels or turn

Manager Response: Thank you so much for your thoughtful review. We are pleased to hear that you enjoyed our spacious hotel and pleasant staff. Summary: Good location, parking is very limited. If you don't find parking inside hotel area you have to park on the street which is not stated on website. The rooms are ok they don't smell bad or good they are just ok. Needs remodeling service ok.

Summary: Just checked in within the past half hour. My 4 yr old daughter kicked off her slippers and in just 10 minutes her feet were black from the dirty floors. The climate control is operated by very old antique wall mount units that barely work. It's humid, and unable to get the room at least cool enough to tolerate.   While checking in they have you sign a piece of paper stating that you agree to still pay for the room even if you leave early. This should've been an immediate flag for me. Now I now why they do that, this place is horrible!  By the way, don't judge by the photos. The rooms and exterior are nothing compared to reality.
Manager Response: First and foremost I would like to sincerely apologize for the items you noted.  we will pass on this information to our housekeeping department and will look into what happend during your stay Thank you again for your business and kind regards!

Summary: My guy and I stayed at Lemon Tree for a Disney weekend. Having said that, our time at the hotel was limited so I don't have too many complaints. I suspect it was  a urine smell that they tried to remove. I wore socks when walking around because I felt like the room wasn't clean enough. The lobby was remodeled so I had expected the rooms to be too. Ours wasn't.

Please do yourselves a favor and don't stay there. The pics you see online are nothing like the actual hotel. The rooms are dirty, the floor is dirty. The bathroom had some awful stains on the walls. The furniture is stain and dirty. We had the family suite and we thought for the price of $154 we would get something decent. Never again!

Summary Heading: Inexpensive Hotel Option: Great for Disneyland
Summary: Lemon Tree is an older budget hotel. Overall, our experience was positive.   Be aware that the front desk expects a $100 deposit upon check in which is refunded a few days after checking out. This was inconvenience and unexpected. Breakfast is basic and provided in a small area.   Our room came with two queen beds, an oven, sink, and microwave and met our basic needs. It was convenient to take the daily shuttle to Disneyland (you need to make reservations in advance). LJ, our shuttle driver, was great to work with as we traveled back and forth from Disneyland each day. Other staff members were quite helpful.   Upon leaving the hotel after checking out, one of the staff ran up to us with my daughter's purse which she had left behind. Thank goodness for that act of kindness.

My biggest issue while staying here is that the property is very dated. The room itself was clean, just in need of many updates. The bathroom was very small and cramped. I did notice while checking in, is that they have a shuttle to Disneyland which would work for families with kids. They also have free breakfast consisting of cereal, coffee, juice and bread.   All in all, I don't think I would stay here again.

At Check in they inform you there is a $100 deposit that is charged at check in!!! Ive heard of a Pet Deposit but a fee in case you damage the room.. NEVER...An what's bad is your room is confirmed on a credit card so you cant even leave.. Because then your out the $110.00 for the room and then they check you into a room that isn't even ready for you!!! I really don't think they care about anyone but GREED! Summary Heading: Sour Experience at the Lemon Tree
Summary: The Lemon Tree Hotel is an inexpensive option for those trying to do Disneyland on a budget. Unfortunately for the Lemon Tree there are much better options within walking distance to the park that will cost a bit more, but not a significant sum.   The rooms in the main building are dilapidated and in need of substantial renovations. There are bungalows behind the main building that have had some flooring updates, but overall the quality is still lacking. it was fairly quiet during our stay, but the walls are thin enough that you can hear the water and shower running in adjacent rooms. The cleanliness of the room left A LOT to be desired, but the front desk service was helpful and friendly.

Summary Heading: Probably would not stay here again
Summary: The Lemon Tree was a lack second reservation for us.    We were unaware that there is a $100 deposit required, and would not stay here again for that reason alone.  The clerk was friendly enough at check in.  Our room looked nothing like the room in the pictures here.  Maybe some rooms are updated?  I thought the rooms were kind of like late 1970's apartments.  It was convenient that there was a little kitchen, even though we didn't use it.  The room was clean, just very old.  When we arrived there were not any parking spots available, but we were allowed to park along the sidewalk in the inside of the hotel complex.   About 10-15 minutes drive from Disneyland.

This place was super cute. Hacienda style with a nice bbq area outside by the pool. We booked this hotel while we visited Disneyland and it describes itself as being within a walking distance from the park which is NOT true, specially if you have children. They offer a free shuttle service that we couldn't even use because we had to book it in advance but no one advised me to do so when I called with other questions the day prior to check in. We got a suite (217) and it was quiet and cozy. Breakfast has a great selection.

Summary Heading: Horrible Service and Overpriced for what you get

Manager Response: Thank you for your review and comment Ralph. I apologize for your inconvenience during your stay. Summary: Had to find a place on late notice after a change in our travel plans. In a ok area without being great, rooms are comfortable enough with free breakfast being offered but rooms feel slightly insecure and noisy. Probably would look elsewhere if I and back and stay in the disneyland area.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and comment Nick. We apologize for not meeting your expectations. We will continue to put our efforts to provide good service and accommodations at budget rates. We are near most major Anaheim attractions and have added free shuttle service to and from Disneyland. We hope you will consider us again on your next visit to Anaheim.

Summary: This was the oddest hotel I have ever stayed in. It looked like an old apartment complex that was turned into a hotel. It was a "2-room suite" which meant there was a bed in what would, I assume, be the living room? The cable didn't work on one of the TVs and maintenance didn't fix it. There were no towels in the room, and 1 roll of toilet paper. I am not a hotel snob and I would never stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We apologize for your inconvenience. However, we have many guests who appreciate our hotel. If you wish to communicate your thoughts or suggestions to us, please contact us at 714-772-0200. Customer service is always our first priority.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel with it's own personal touches.
Summary: Parking lot can get a little full but they are accommodating with some of the areas that you can squeeze a car in.  Hotel had lots of personal flavor that kept it from feeling like every other hotel in the area.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for taking the time to give us your feedback It is greatly appreciated. I am happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and we look forward to your visit in the future.

Summary: room were very clean and the staff were very friendly and nice , location is great lots of restaurants nearby , worth the $73 paid through hhotels tonight , would recommend this hotel to every one. thank you
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We value our guests and work hard to provide good service and accommodations at the best possible rates. We look forward to seeing you during your next stay with us.

Summary: I needed to find a room for a couple of days at Disneyland. The Lemon Tree is alright but I probably wouldn't stay here again. I paid $156 a night (tax included) for a room for two with a king sized bed. The bed was comfortable but the pillows were terrible. The towels in the bathroom are really coarse, leading me to believe that they were old and had been washed many times in harsh detergent. An investment in new towels and pillows would go a long way in improving the rooms. One other thing that bothered me was housekeeping. I had a candy bar our first night here and left the wrapper on the night stand. It was still there when I got back the next evening. They didn't change the sheets and instead just made the bed. The spot on the sheets we noticed the first night was still
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and we are sorry that we did not meet your expectations. We work hard to provide our guests with good service and clean & comfortable accommodations at the best rates for our guests. We have many happy customers that frequently stay with us. Our housekeepers clean the room but they cannot assume that an item is trash if it the guest left it on the counters or did not put it into the waste baskets. In order to conserve water, we do not replace the bed sheets for 2 night stays if the guest leaves them on the bed (California is in a serious drought situation). However, if the guest requests new sheets, they will be provided. Most hotels follow this policy for bed sheets and towels. We offer complimentary breakfast which most guests appreciate. However, there are many nice breakfast restaurants in the area that have much larger selection. We hope you will give us another try when you visit Anaheim again.

Summary: After I checked I started walking to my room.  Hallway carpet looked like it had not been vacuumed in days.  Carpet pulling away from the wall, huge replastering mark on the wall.  I booked a room with a full kitchen.  As I looked at the counters I saw old dry food particles.  I called and asked for sanitizer.  They sent someone in to clean. After he left he said I can't get the dried over sprayed paint off.  I said as long as you clean up the dried food.  The next morning I go to take a shower and there was an old dried wash cloth hanging over the shower curtain rod.  I thought it was a cleaning rag but after looking at the towels I realized it was no different than the clean towels.  They all looked like the reject towels you use to wash and dry your car with.  Will avoid this
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and we are sorry that we did not meet your expectation. We work hard to provide a clean & comfortable environment for our guests. We have supervisors to insure that each guests obtains quality products and service. We are constantly improving the quality of our products and will make sure that the individuals in charge of ordering uses better judgement to purchase good quality towels, bed sheets and pillows. We hope that you give us another try the next time you stay in Anaheim.

Summary: Rooms were small and not clean, very noisy with cars pulling in and out all night, police were called into hotel after vehicles were broken into and had windscreen smashed would not stay there again, we used it as a stop off for Disney and should have looked at reviews before we went.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and we are sorry we did not meet your expectation. We work hard to provide a safe and clean environment for our guests at the best possible rates. Additional lighting was added to the parking lot and the courtyards in addition to having security guards patrolling the grounds nightly. We have many happy guests that frequently stay with us. We hope you will give us another try.

Summary Heading: Clean and comfortable. Ideal for a few nights
Summary: My friend and  I stayed here for 3 nights on a trip to Disneyland. It's  good price. Large comfy rooms, clean facilities. Pool area is ok.  About 10 minute drive from food places and 15 to disneyland park.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We value our guests who appreciate the efforts we make to provide a clean and comfortable environment at the best possible rates for our guests. We are looking forward to seeing you again during your next stay with us.

Summary Heading: There's no way to like or hate this property
Summary: I was charged an upgrade fee to not sleep with my friend, I've never stayed at a hotel with two guests listed on our itinerary & and then just slammed into one bed. There was upcharge to not sleep together. The rooms are cute, however there was party next door and stray cats throughout the property. The sheets had random hair & eye makeup on them. I woke up in the middle of the night to pincher bugs in the bathroom. This was a nice hotel but then things that were not ok were severely not ok. There's no way to say you 100% don't like the place, but you leave very clear that you 100% do not like the hotel. It's a hinky feeling, not helped by it appearing to be some sort of extended stay arrangement with some of the people lurking outside smoking on the non-smoking property. Anyone
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We appreciate your business. We do have different rates for a singe bed and a double bed. We apologize for any miscommunication but this is explained in the websites. We hope we can better serve you the next time you visit. We work hard to provide the best service to our guests.

Summary: My wife and I used to stay at this hotel every trip to Disneyland. This hotel once had a sweet country charm that was hard to beat with a great price close to Disneyland. The price and proximity to Disneyland have not changed. But everything else has. The charm is gone. The toilet would not flush. The sink would not drain. Our bed sheets had sneaker prints going across the bed. It was dirty and disgusting. We didn't even have soap in the bathroom or a trash can! The electrical outlets didn't work, either. Too bad for this hotel that was once a great place to visit.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are sorry that we did meet your expectation, but we have made a great effort to improve the quality of the hotel. We have made many improvement and upgrades to the rooms such as ac, refrigerators, televisions, microwaves, hair dryers, curtains and much more. The best equipment was put in place for the internet to insure great reception throughout the hotel. The front desk, hallways, pool & pool deck have all been renovated. Even a new jet spa was added to the hot tub. The patio area was made even more spacious and safe. Surveillance cameras and other safety items were added or improved. Nightly security guards were hired to increase safety as well as more lighting throughout. The hotel staff have undergone intensive training and the housekeeping & maintenance supervisors have been given the responsibility to monitor quality control. We constantly check the quality of the work performed by the staff to insure the best possible environment for the guests. We receive many positive review from the guests. Thank you again for your stay with us.

Summary: This hotel is very appealing..it looks nice and convenient..however, we were Black American friends traveling..the Latino groundskeeper gave us very uninviting behavior. He never greeted us just stared in a eerie way..then as we settled in we heard banging by our room all of a sudden..it was a tool shed open and the same guy right by our door making a mess and loud..we turned on the jacuzzi and as we got in..we were interrupted yet again by the guy. We were on the bottom floor and he complained water was leaking thru. Im like where the basement????? After the medical marijuana laws changed this hotel after the fact exclaimed all rooms are no smoking regardless of medicinal..while we left the room clean and aired completely out we still got an extra charge of 200 dollars. So

Our guests expect the rooms to not have any smoke odors and when the previous guest smoked in the room, our staff has to spend much more time and effort to sterilize the room...even to the extent of placing the room out of order until the smell dissipates. The additional fee barely covers the hotels cost of rehabilitating the room.

Summary: At under $70 a night, I wasn't expecting much. My room was clean, the bed was comfortable, there is a microwave, coffee maker and fridge in the room. The staff was attentive and very friendly. Close to The Packing House and several breweries. A very nice stay for the cheap.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your review. We work very hard to provide the best environment for our guests. We provide a very good service at an affordable price for our guests. We appreciate guests like you who motivate and encourage us to continue our efforts in making the hotel a great place for our guests.

Summary: Just checked in and very unhappy already. Just came from a gorgeous room in San Diego as we make our way down the coast. Even got a free upgrade there as its our honeymoon. As for here-motel. My husband just got out of a cold shower. Joining belconys (with other rooms) and our fridge doesn't work. Told the front desk and they said they'd send someone 20 mins ago. Unhappy!!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are sorry for your unhappy experience. We work hard to provide the best environment and service to our guests. We have full-time maintenance personnel to make sure everything is in working order. The balconies are now private.

Summary: For what we paid, it was not worth it. Covers had stains on them. The jacuzzi also had hair in it and water marks from the previous guests! Very gross!! There was hair all over the floor and shower. Didn't seam clean at all. The "breakfast" was nothing to talk about either. This was marked as a 3 star.... Definitely a 2 star...
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We apologize if your experience was not as great as we hoped. We work hard to make sure the rooms are clean and sanitized while providing a fair and affordable price for our guests. Our staff have gone through extensive training and our supervisors monitor the quality of the work performed. We will continue to make improvements to insure our guest have positive experience during their stay.

Summary: We booked this hotel based on location close to Disney and the 3 star rating.   Unfortunately the neighborhood was marginal and it went downhill from there. The check in person was nice enough but the room smelled, was generally worn and dirty looking, and a large Cockroach ran across the floor within 10 minutes of arriving. We also didn't feel like it was in a safe neighborhood and didn't like the exterior entrances.   We left immediately so I don't know how the room would have actually been to sleep in.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. Please note that the area the hotel is located is very safe and near all the Anaheim attractions such as Disney, Convention Center, Honda Center, Angel Stadium and others. The city of Anaheim has placed great effort in safety and we are benefiting from this. There are new town homes and communities being build around the hotel. The hotel has plenty of lighting in the parking area and the patios as well as nightly security patrol and surveillance cameras. Most guests feel very safe and secure staying at the hotel. We are constantly working hard to provide the best environment for the guests.

Summary: We just returned from a two day stay at this hotel for the purpose of visiting Disneyland.  We booked through Hotwire and were surprised when we arrived and discovered that the pictures of the property were not exactly accurate. We stayed the first night n Room 131 and although this was billed as a "suite" we were very disappointed. It was more like a one story motel at this particular part of the property. We asked if we could move the second night to a better location. Our request was accommodated and we were moved to Room 105 in the main building. This room was not much different than the first room.   The front desk staff were very friendly and nice. The continental breakfast was ok. We were looking around to see where the pictures on the website could possibly have been
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to give us your feedback. We are doing a lot of reservations and we hope to make improvements in the near future. I apologize for the inconveniences the rooms in the photos are on the second floor in the main building where the front desk is located. We hope to see you again in the future!

Summary: First mistake was booking on Hotwire, won't be doing that again. Hotwire listed this property as a 3 star boutique hotel, in reality this is a 1.5 star motel 2 at best. I've stayed at 2.5 star hotels that feel like 5 star resorts compared to this place. It worked in a pinch but I would not go back. Bed was lumpy, sheets and blanket old and worn. Towels worn and rough
Manager Response: I apologize for these inconveniences during your stay. I will make sure to get this to the correct departments in order to have these issues resolved. Thank you for taking the time to give us your feedback it is valued here at The Lemon Tree Hotel.

Summary: We were really pleasantly surprised at how nice this hotel was for what we paid. Our room was lovely and spacious and spotlessly clean, all members of staff were friendly and hard working, the pool, although small was very welcome to have a cool off. The breakfast was also better than we expected it to be with a fair choice of items and it was nice to be able to sit outside and eat it, I also appreciated the guest laundry room which, again, was clean with modern appliances. I would not hesitate to return here
Manager Response: Thank you very much Carina for your feedback it apprecated here with us. I am so happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and we look forward to seeing you in the future. Thank you again for your feedback. -Joseph Asst Hotel Manager

Summary: There are many nice looking rooms posted online, yet we managed to get a room that had a funky smell, the sheets were ripped and stained, the mattress was old and dirt looking, and apparently they charged for using the dish soap and other stuff like the pan??, pretty ridiculous. The staff was nice, but I don't see myself coming back here again.
Manager Response: I apologize for the inconveniences during your stay with us. I will make sure this information is passed on to each department in order for them to make improvement. Thank you for taking the time to give us feedback in order to make the necessary corrections.

Summary Heading: Ran out of options for hotel under $200 a night offering a King bed in a sepreate bedroom from a Queen Bed
Summary: Save 10 % on your stay and call hotel directly to make reservations, this beat all the website offers I found. NO ELEVATOR, 2 flights of stairs to the upper levels of several buildings.  We saw a large dog so they must allow them in the rooms (which is a warning to those whom may be allergic)  Waited until the weekend before we needed a hotel near Disneyland. Originally looking to stay at Embassy Suites which was over $230 a night then they wanted an additional $17 a day for parking and $6 for Wi-Fi.  To save over $200 on the trip we took a chance with this hotel which had free parking and Wi-Fi,   I wanted a room that had a separate bedroom with a door to close due to snoring. Stayed July 27, 2015 for 3 nights in a ONE BED PATIO, which is a King bed in a bedroom with a door,
Manager Response: Thank you Mary H for taking the time to provide us with such detailed feedback about your stay. As of August 1st, 2015, we no longer allow pets at our hotel. I am very sorry to hear that several things throughout your stay did not meet your expectations. Please note that your concerns have been passed on to our management team. We do hope you give us another chance as we will definitely improve our services.

Summary: Arrived later than I wanted & still had to get to LAX to pick up friends.  I was given directions when I checked in that saved a lot of time getting to LAX.  Room was clean but no shower curtain, door strike wasn't screwed in which made it hard to open, LJ (maintanence) fixed it right away.  Housekeeping quickly responded with the extra towels we requested.  Check out was quick.  Breakfast was a bit kaotick, set up & prep area is too small when 3 or more people are there, patio area seating needs to be rearranged so the tables can seat 4.  Try adding a separate counter for coffee, juice, cups & offset one of the tables & chairs for more room.
Manager Response: Thank you Cathy for your review and glad that your staff were able to assist you during your stay with us.  Sorry for all the inconveniences and notes will be forward to our management team.  Once again, thank you.

Summary: Nice stay for the money spent. If you're wealthy, snooty, and want a 5 star resort move on. THIS hotel is for a family on a budget going to Disneyland. Because Disneyland is expensive all buy itself and thats another story.
Manager Response: Thanks AIK for the review.  Glad you had a wonderful time at Disneyland with your family during your visit in July.

Summary: Stayed here for a weekend family trip to Disneyland, and was pleaseantly suprised! Decent average rooms, clean, a had a little bit of that hotel staleness, but over all in good condition. not too far from Disney, tho some of the surrounding area was kind of iffy...Lots of families, and noise wasn't really an issue. Grounds were nice, except for one spot at the bottom of the stairs where employees were leaving bags of trash....Overall, nice place if you're on a budget!
Manager Response: Thank you Shernandez1082 for sharing your stay experience with us. Hope you had a wonderful time at Disneyland.

Summary: Construction going on in the hotel can't sleep in the morning...traffic on Lincoln St is ok not too bad the pool and hot tube are nice and clean.  The pool is 8ft and hot tub is nice. Our room was nice and clean.   I just didn't like how it was so hard to find a parking space at night. The place parking get full at night beware of that... so other than that, great experience and loving this place it's not fancy place to stay but it is safe and Lin is the front desk man that checked us in he was super nice and sweetheart. We will definitely be back again.
Manager Response: Dear Traveler,  Thank you for taking the time to review your stay with us. I am very happy to hear that our staff made your feel welcome. This is really one of the things that we try to maintain in our hotel. Hoping to see you again soon.

Summary: It is not in my habit to stay at accommodations that are not 4 stars or better but due to it being a last minute trip I took the chance. During our stay we were delightfully surprised with the rooms being nicer than your stereotypical horror movie room. During our stay the power went out on property for an entire day. The reason I am giving the lemon tree two stars if the lack of customer service. In unforeseen events like what occurred it would have been nice to get just a simple apology for the inconvenience after being forced to take a dark cold shower. Even that was too much to ask from the hotel staff. Sometimes the simple things go along way. But what can you say, you get what you pay for, right?
Manager Response: Dear RJ H,  Thank you for your positive comments and I am pleased that you had a good stay overall.However, I apologize for the inconveniences that you experienced during your stay and don't hesitate to call me to share more information and I will try my best to rectify the situation.

Summary: The rooms are decent size and most have been updated. They come with a small fridge, microwave and coffee maker. The beds are comfortable and clean. The internet speed is great and the cable TV brings in lots of channels. Breakfast is simple but better than just the typical continental you get at most hotels. I will stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear Boneytd,  We are deeply elated that we have been your constant hotel of choice when you're in Anaheim. As always, don't hesitate to let us know if you're visiting again soon. Our staff are always ready to help you with anything. Thank you and take care.

Summary Heading: I'll just rest my head here for a minute

Pros:  Decently close to disney Beds were comfortable Plenty of towels Flat screen tv  Unique room with FULL SIZE fridge. Honestly I've never been to a hotel that had a full size fridge so that was cool.  Patio seats outside the room Pool and bbq area  Cons:  No laundry bag  No take home amenities (but honestly if this keeps the room price down then I'm totally fine with that). Room got humid if the AC wasn't on  Resort fee!! I just don't understand that at all Parking is VERY limited. They let us park
Manager Response: Dear Goosegoose62,  Thank you for your candid review and for choosing our hotel. I‚Äôm happy that you enjoyed your stay and I‚Äôm looking forward to having you again as a guest in our hotel.

My daughters in a wheelchair and there was a cat in front of our door and no parking on our side of the hotel and after they said they would correct the  problem they didn't and everyone blamed the other!! Summary: me and my girlfriend visit the disneyland for the 2nd time, and we choose the lemon tree hotel this time, it was a real nice experienceÔºåthe guy from front desk is super nice and helpful, they have a little BBQ grill in the garden, we had some reallyyyyyy goooood steak and had a good time . we will 100 percent come back if we go to disneyland again!

Manager Response: Dear NevaRamsey, Thank you for your positive feedback about our hotel and staff.  We are happy that you enjoyed your stay.

Summary: If you want excellent amenities, this might not be the place.  But if you want excellent services, this is the place.  Thanks Lin for helping our family settle in Orange County while we stayed at Lemon Tree.  Pro: Fast WiFi, nice breakfast selection, large suite rooms, EXCELLENT STAFF SERVICE (unlike other 5-star hotels with employees who have their eyes above their heads)  Con: Many reviews of this place as being a motel rather than a hotel which is somewhat correct but not run-down, small bathroom, lack of amenities (i.e. shower cap)
Manager Response: Thank you Sammi for the 5 stars! We will make sure to share the review with all our staff.

Summary Heading: Oh, my. A small dingy room in a bad part of town
Summary: My corporate office is in Anaheim. I am here for a week of meetings, and decided to fly in early and take the weekend to have some fun with friends. This hotel is NOT a 3 star, nor even a 2 star property by any stretch of the imagination.  I did not realize that Orange County has sketchy areas, but this is definitely a place where I am going to double lock the door. I had to go to the front desk 3 times to get my room key to work. The room is pathetically small and dingy. The normal amenities of soap, shampoo are dispensers on the wall of the shower. I have NEVER seen this in a hotel. I will never, ever stay here again. See the pictures I am posting to give you a better idea of the condition of the room.
Manager Response: Dear KimlnJax,  I‚Äôm deeply sorry to hear that your room keys deactivated during your stay and the in-room Paya Organics amenities did not fit your needs.  I appreciate your feedback and will definitely look into these matters.

When we arrived at the hotel, we were upgraded to the King Jacuzzi suite with a complimentary bottle of champagne in the room to greet us. What an awesome surprise!   The front counter staff were exceptionally friendly and the hotel is only about 5-6 minutes drive to Disneyland. The Original pancake house is close by and there breakfasts and amazing!  Would not hesitate to stay here again!!
Manager Response: Dear Guest. Happy 20th! I am so glad to hear that your stay was so wonderful, especially during such a special occasion. We hope to welcome you and your wife back to the hotel in the near future!

Summary: I booked through Hotwire. It was a big Mistake!  The rate was supposed to be $189.00 per night. If you would pay $60 they would be lucky.The hotel is quite run down. I think the staff try hard but the conditions are not up to par. I checked out after one night. I am not sure who would give this a great review. Safe yourself the hassle and don't book here or use Hot Wire.
Manager Response: Dear Iana196908,  I‚Äôm sorry for your bad experience and thank you for taking the time out to give us your stay experience feedback.    Thank you.

Summary Heading: Beware Expedia unpublished rate for 3 star boutique hotel in Disneyland North

My impression was that there were better rooms, with interior entry, closer to the check-in desk. Room 150 was a motel styled room with direct entry from the parking lot, thin walls and mini kitchen setup, which would have been nice if the drainage smell was dealt with. I had to check out after just a few hours on my one night stay. Might consider this motel-hotel in the future for one of the nicer rooms, given that the staff was very courteous.
Manager Response: Dear Msutt,  Thank you for your review. I am glad to hear that overall your experience was positive. I amdisappointed to hear that our room service and housekeeping staff didn't meet your expectations. This critical feedback will be used in training our staff. Thank you and look forward to seeing you soon.

Summary: I'm giving this hotel a 5-star review because it exceeded my expectations dramatically. It's a cheap, 2-star hotel that I got a great deal on, so i was expecting little more than a bed in a broom closet. But it was in fact a fantastic hotel room that rivals Days Inns or Holiday Inns for sure. My room had a toaster oven and a microwave, as well as a fridge, which meant I didn't have to eat every meal out. It's also out of the Disney Zone, so its' much cheaper and Disneyland was still only a $5 Uber away! Awesome!
Manager Response: Wow Martin F! What a wonderful review, we truly appreciate your business and your turst in us.  I am very happy to hear that our staff and service exceed your needs and expecations.  We look forward to welcoming you back to the hotel in the near future.

Summary Heading: Expected much more...sure there are better choices in Anaheim for the same price
Summary: The smell in the lobby and rooms was really bad.  Needed some heavy duty cleaning and decorating advise.  Old notices at the front desk and just an overall dirty feeling. We were disappointed as usual the photos look much better than the place actually is. Landscaping needs attention too.  Not far from Disneyland but that was the only thing it had going for it, sorry couldn't report a wonderful stay.
Manager Response: Thank you 2songbird for your feedback.  We definitely investigate into the things you mentioned.  Once again, thank you for opportunity to improve.

Summary: Buyer beware. Hotwire, Expedia & Lemon Tree Suites.   I recently booked a hotel for the Anaheim, California area through Hotwire. They advertised a rate of $189.00 a night for $83.25 a night. I have used Hotwire before and have loved the service and value I had received. There for when I booked this six night stay my expectation was based on my previous experiences. Once the hotel was booked, I got a confirmation of which hotel was selected. To my utter shock I was notified that I was booked in at the Lemon Tree Suites. I then checked the Lemon Tree website to see the $189.00 room and found that there wasn't one! I was scammed! I called Hotwire and was notified that they go by the neighborhood average for the advertised rate. In other words, there are various hotels in the area

We value every guest service request/complaint and do our best to improve.  We take all necessary precautions when issues are brought to our attention.  We called in the specialist to inspect the room and the report came back clean.   Thank you for the opportunity and your time.

Summary: Myself, my wife and our 5 year old daughter stayed here for a couple of nights while we went to Disneyland. Lemon tree was nice and clean, the rooms were spacious with a nice couch in front of the t.v. had a nice little balcony, they have a nice Mexican restaurant right in the same parking lot of the hotel. The staff was courteous. The lobby consisted of the old Spanish style d√©cor.

With that said, I'm presently staying here after booking the hotel via the Hotwire app. For those unfamiliar with the app, you book 'blind' when it comes to the hotel's name, only knowing amenities, general area, star level, and guest approval rating. With Hotwire, if there are resort fees, it specifies them, and indicates that you will pay those at the hotel, but you pay the rest of the total in advance, directly to Hotwire. Summary Heading: Best Value I've Found in the Area
