Summary: This hotel was excellent from the start. We decided to stay at this hotel because it offered a separate bedroom within the hotel room. For the price to fit 3 couples in for one night it was perfect. My husband and I were weary about staying in a new hotel since we have a normal place to stay in when we go to Disneyland. But since we had more people coming with us, we decided to try out a new hotel. The hotel itself was quaint inside and out. The hotel room had an old fashion mission look. With stone/hard flooring in the two beds/living room area, it was nice and cozzy. The king bed bedroom had carpet. They had a full kitchen. We were able to store our left overs from dinner and heat it up using their stove top or microwave. They had pots, pans, dinnerware and silverware. But you
Manager Response: It‚Äôs great to know that we meet and exceed your expectation!  Thank you for giving us the opportunity to do so.  We look forward to your return.

The carpet needed to be vacuumed and was very dirty evidenced by my black socks! The lock on the sliding glass door was broken.  The curtains were falling off the rod and the string to open/close the drapes was not attached or working.    The towels are old and cheap.  The "orange juice" is tang.  Internet is very slow. We are constantly striving to improve and update our hotel while maintaining the antique touch.  We will look the issues of your room and correct it right away.  Thank you so much for your feedback.

It's affordable, but don't expect top of the line accommodations. The room I stayed in with a jacuzzi tub was dated, and in disrepair. Only 1 bed courtyard studio photo was provided on line, I assume the 2 queen bed courtyard studio will be the same or similar. THAT'S NOT TURE!!!!! The kitchen was very clean, but very old and in a very unfinished setting. The fridge is big but make on-and-off LOUD noises all the time because it's old. The outside of the hotel looked old and broken,not like the photos you see on line. This is a very disappointed experience even though the front desk staffs were friendly.

Upon arrival, the room was disgustingly filthy and the stench was unbearable.  Unbelievable that they would consider this room even remotely livable.  When we complained at the front desk, they would do nothing to repair or improve the situation.  Moved to a different hotel.  But Lemon Tree insists they still charge for one night even tho we didn't stay.  Don't waste your money.

After a long research over the internet, my wife came across Lemontree hotels & suites in California. As she surfed through, she was quite impressed with what all it had to offer. Generous sized beds and queen sofa in the living room were comfortable.  The best thing about

This was the 8th place we stayed at on our road trip, we know what we are talking about,  we have now completed our road trip, and without a doubt, it was the worse place. A group of members stay here for our family reunion.  It was the perfect location for all of us.  Kids headed to Disneyland and teens shopped at South Coast Plaza Shopping Center while our adults relaxing by an outdoor pool. We just loved it here.  Beds were comfy and showers were hot. Everything was clean and the staff was really nice.  If you are looking for an inexpensive and cozy boutique hotel, I would recommend it to you.

This Hotel is fairly good value and the rooms are pleasant. The location is handy for visiting the nearby attractions and restaurants. Summary Heading: If this gets a good rating...what are you use to?
Summary: Decor is awful and everything appears old and used up.  Every time the A/C cycled on it woke me up and yet NEVER cooled our room to a comfortable sleeping level.  Management if you know the room is to be used, please leave the A/C on even just a bit.  Walking into a stale, hot room after a 6 hour drive is NOT welcoming.  Luckily, we had only booked one room since we decided to start our vacation earlier and our other hotel was booked.  The breakfast was pathetic...cheerios mixed with fruit loops and green oranges (no bananas).  Come on, it won't break the bank to make the breakfast a bit better or just don't offer it instead of failing so miserably at it.    Only pluses, the bed was comfortable which probably to others would be too firm and the shower was hot with good pressure.

Summary: We were so happy that the beds were comfortable, which was great after a day walking. For the price, this was a decent stay of 5 nights. The breakfast was the usual minimal and the outside of the motel could use some sprucing up, but it was quiet and convenient and a little bit away from the crowds and traffic.We had a microwave, small fridge, coffeemaker, TV, air conditioning, some dishes and utensils.We found pizza and sub places close by.Asked for adjoining rooms and got 2 right next to each other, as well as on the first floor, which we appreciated.Had a little difficulty getting ice as desk is not always manned, but overall enjoyed our stay and would recommend this place as well as stay there again.

We stayed at the Lemon Tree this month and had a great stay. We had a garden room which was well-equipped with a kitchen area and everything needed. It was true, as others have said, that the decor is not quite as in the pics in all rooms. But although the furniture was a bit dated, everything was clean and it had a certain charm. Some reviewers have mentioned that the hotel's not in a good part of town. I think perhaps these reviewers have not experienced much because there was nothing shady about this part of town. It is not right by Disneyland - which was fine for us as we weren't here for that reason - but it is by no means a bad part of town.  The hotel is more like an apartment complex with some two-storey and some single-storey parts, a swimming pool, laundry room and

To his credit, he managed to keep his cool and was very polite.  So much for teamwork though.  We found our rooms but didn't go in as our flight got in late and we were running behind for a business dinner.  Walking through the main hallway you could see right in the laundry room, which either had no door or it was propped open to a giant pile of dirty laundry. I really feel like in the evenings, the room cleanings should be done and hallways carpets vacuumed to make a nice presentation for incoming

Summary Heading: Super clean, great value at an affordable price
Summary: We had an extended stay and really appreciated the clean, newly upgraded room, comfortable bed, the kitchenette, the friendly staff, and access to a barbecue.   Best value in the area in my opinion.  The only downside was that during the time we were there, there was lots of work being done on the property (understandable) and service to the room seemed sporadic. Sometimes in morning or after 7 pm. Pool area was nice. Fitness equipment and jacuzzi didn't seem to be functioning but I enjoyed having a coy pond outside my room.

Summary: I loved the room. For the money, I found it clean and quaint... What I did find appalling was the over flowing trash dumpsters to the point of ridiculous. There's no way that much garbage accumulates in a single week. So there's got to be an issue with collecting it by local waste management. It was hard to look at. Additionally the hotel looked very dilapidated in many areas and looks run down. My check in experience wasn't the best either. I found the female clerk to be brash and a somewhat arrogant. She was training a new hire and seemed short tempered. Also made a snide comment about the street name I lived on which was inappropriate. All-in-all I would probably return if not just for the nice room I had. Nothing else stood out about this business.

Summary Heading: Good enough at the right price
Summary: Needing a spot for one night that was close to the Honda Center, we found this hotel fit out needs.  The room was clean; beds were good; A/C worked; the kitchenette and bath facilities were functional.  In the morning, a light continental breakfast was served in a pleasant room off of the main reception area.  The hotel has a swimming pool, gym facilities and a laundry room, but we did not use any of these services during our brief staff.  Shopping facilities are within walking distance and include major chain groceries as well as small restaurants and a 99 cent store.  This hotel is located in an older neighborhood and is of the same vintage as the rest of the area.  Relative to other venues in the same price range, this is a good deal.  We would return, should the occasion

My family and I found the Lemon Tree Hotel while visiting for a Disneyland trip. It was close to the resort, but felt like we were away from all the congestion of other tourists. And though it was exciting finding this Mexican "secret garden" it also felt like home. We even saved money fixing some meals using the complementary stove/microwave and fridge (shopping at a local supermarket nearby).   The staff was very friendly and helpful, the water fountain pool and hot tub looked inviting (but we didn't get a chance to jump in) and there was even a pond with coy! It was so nice!!! I can't wait to go back for our next adventure!

My 13 year old daughter and I stayed here for 2 days and had a great time. The rooms were very comfortable and clean, with my daughter remarking that the bed was the most comfortable she had been on in a long time. The staff was friendly and helpful. The pool was small but clean.   One piece of constructive criticism... Get a better wireless router! My daughter was going through Facebook with drawls not being able to connect her iPod. (Not that I minded at all!) A business traveler or somebody needing to use a laptop might get a little frustrated though.

had a good stay. rooms were good, room service was efficient and the staff was quite helpful and location is quite convenient. Its easy to tour the city from here. would definitely recommend this property for business and family trips as well. overall a good property

This hotel features a restaurant, a health club, and a bar/lounge. Traveling on business? Take advantage of the 24-hour business center, express check-out, and valet parking.  WiFi is available.Boasting comforts like pillow top beds and premium bedding, the 1000+ guestrooms offer WiFi and LCD TVs with digital channels. Other amenities include room service, coffee/tea makers, and hair dryers.

Summary Heading: Great value and you can see many improvements coming
Summary: My family stayed last weekend for 2 nights while going to Disneyland. Despite a previous reviewer's comment, it is NOT in a bad part of town- it is surrounded by an average middle class neighborhood, schools, stores and restaurants- just down the road from the Mighty Ducks ice rink, City Hall, Anaheim High School, etc. Lincoln Ave is an exit right off Interstate 5 so it was easy to find and easy to get to the Disney parks (7 minute drive to parking structure). Our room was clean with an very comfortable bed and simple, tasteful linens. The room was a good size with a corner kitchenette, dining area, and sink area separate from the toilet/shower (very convenient in the morning when many people are getting ready). Free basic continental breakfast in the lobby. Wi-Fi (free and

My mother and I stayed in a one bedroom apartment for 10 nights. The room was lovely, so clean and tidy. The reception staff were lovely and so very helpfully.  The hotel has a bus stop right outside the front so very easy to get around. The two tours we did, picked us up and dropped us back, right at the front door so no worries there. And the Lemon tree is about a 5 minute walk away from a handy shopping centre.  I would defiantly recommend the Lemon Tree to anyone!

We stayed only for one night - arrived late and left early, so we did not get to enjoy the pool. We were upgraded to a suite with two separate rooms and a full kitchen - great value for the money! Everything was impeccably clean.  We would definitely stay here again.

After traveling for hours we arrived at the hotel around 12:30pm and they said no rooms were cleaned and to come back at 2:00pm check in time.  We came back and went to our room and since the hotel looked nothing like the hotel on the internet and was in a bad area and also listed furnished apts and was pretty shady looking and had a cloth wall hanging behind the bed we got our flashlight out to check for bed bugs and behind our pillows was a pair of dirty black underwear.  Thought they were cleaning the rooms?  Rented the room off the net for $110.00, expedia printed on the invoice but they wouldn't claim it said it was a subsidary of theirs and it took me 1/2hr in hotel lobby to get a refunded started.  No manager on premises to talk to!!! STAY AWAY.

Summary: With 5 kids and 2 adults in our family we needed an affordable hotel with adequate space and a kitchen in the Anaheim area for one week. The Lemon Tree was the ticket. The larger 2 bedroom suite with 2 bathrooms was a great fit for us. It may not have been the most updated hotel we've ever stayed in but with a big family we'd stay there again. Yes worst hotel parking I've had.The outdoor shared BBQ and eating area is fantastic! Staff were friendly and very helpful.

I stayed at the lemon tree suites in a king studio i believe it was called. Room was spacious, comfortable bed, seemed to be very clean. Had two mini fridges (i only used one for juice and soda), sink, toaster oven with two burners on top (never used), a kitchen sink. The bathroom with toilet and.shower was a little tight but adequate and clean. Overall, the room was great. The parking kinda sucked. Many people parked up against curbs. I did initially just to unload, but then moved to a pretty far away parking spot. If the parking was better, location a little closer to the freeway, and just a little cheaper, i would have given this place a 5 all the way. Side note: I didnt partake of continental breakfast, nor did i use the pool or bbq area, but both seem adequate as well.

Yes I love that also; however, as a first time mother-daughter trip  to CA; I preferred to spend my $$ on winery tours, shopping and experiencing all this region has to offer!  The reviews of The Lemon Tree were good so gave it a try. Driving into the area where the hotel is located gave me extreme anxiety about that decision. I figured it's only for one and we not going to spend much time in the room anyway. Was I ever wrong! This is now my place. It is close to everything. Driving distance to attractions, my favorite was Med evil Times. I met some great people and the front desk  printed driving directions to Santa Monica pier, Venice beach and the fashion distirct. I enjoy the breakfast

We are happy to you have selected us as your to-go hotel when in visiting the Anaheim area.   Sincerely,  Guest Relations Manager

Summary Heading: Very nice stay for my family.
Summary: My family of 5 really enjoyed this hotel. We were there for 5 nights in one of the one bedroom apartments. Unlike other reviews, our kitchen was fully stocked, all we had to add was the food. Our kids loved the fish pond right outside our room. The front desk staff was very pleasant and offered to print out any google maps we needed. The house keeping staff were great. We had been washing our own dishes daily but one morning we left some glasses and coffee cups in a hurry to get out to Disneyland only to come back to find them washed and set out for our next use. We have already recommended this hotel to family traveling out there a week after us and will definitely stay here next time we travel to SoCal area.
Manager Response: We are extremely happy to read of the wonderful experience you had while staying with us at The Lemon Tree Hotel and Suites. As you were able to experience, all of our rooms are as immaculate as possible and our housekeeping department do their absolute best to provide our guest with a relaxing, worry free experience. Thank you once again for the wonderful feedback and great comments about our hotel.   Kindly, Guest Relations Manager

Summary Heading: We made the most we could out of it!
Summary: We really tried to make the most out of this hotel... It wasn't easy. We booked this hotel because they offered a full kitchen, which in reality they did.  The trouble was that the kitchen was not stocked at all. Lemon Tree advertises the money saving cost of staying in a hotel with a kitchen... however, there were no cooking utensils, one small sauce pan and a tiny frying pan. We were a family of 5, and didn't have anything to cook with.  A trip to the store was in order where we bought disposable pans to cook with.  I begged the front desk people for cooking utensils, and told them I wanted to use their BBQ. They did find a spatula and BBQ fork in the back.  When we got to the BBQ the family that was using it didn't have any utensils.  It seems to me that if you advertise the

Just to let you know that we have a twenty-four hour front desk, so the problem with the kitchen utensils would have easily been fixed if it had been brought up to our team members during your first night at our hotel. Thank you once again for bringing this to our attention. We greatly value your feedback.   Sincerely, Guest Relations Manager

Summary: Very unique hotel near Disneyland. We stayed three nights in a room with a kitchen. Every day was well cleaned and included breakfast. The pool was warm and spacious with cute water spouts from two turtles. All the staff were friendly and helpful.
